TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed WorkflowTheme extends System.Object implements class System.IDisposable
Public NotInheritable Class WorkflowTheme Implements IDisposable
public ref class WorkflowTheme sealed : IDisposable

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated. Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")

Docs.summary: Provides the look and feel property settings to a workflow in design-time environment.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/includes/deprecatedcontent-md.md)]
Workflow themes define the look and feel of a workflow design surface. This includes background styles, foreground styles, fonts, and icons defined for the workflow.
A <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowTheme> is a theme defined for a specific workflow. The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme> class can be used for default properties if a specific workflow theme is not desired.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property AmbientTheme As AmbientTheme

Docs.summary: Gets the associated with the .
Docs.value: An that describes default values for the look and feel of the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme> describes the look and feel of a workflow design surface. This includes background styles, foreground styles, fonts, and icons defined for the workflow design surface.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to access the `AmbientTheme` property. This example is from the Tracking Profile Designer SDK sample. For more information, see [Tracking Profile Designer Sample](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/dotnet/netframework-3.5/ms742004(v=vs.90)).

## Remarks Use <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowTheme.CurrentTheme%2A> to make changes to the theme used to display the workflow.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowTheme.CurrentTheme%2A> property to access the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme> associated with a workflow.
This code example is part of the Workflow Monitor SDK Sample from the DesignerGlyphProvider.cs file. For more information, see [Workflow Monitor](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/dotnet/netframework-3.5/ms741706(v=vs.90)).
